pytealutils.math.math.bytes_to_int(x: <TealType.bytes: 1>)
pytealutils.math.math.div_ceil(a: <TealType.uint64: 0>, b: <TealType.uint64: 0>) → pyteal.Expr

Returns the result of division rounded up to the next integer

pytealutils.math.math.even(x: <TealType.uint64: 0>)

even returns 1 if x is even

pytealutils.math.math.exponential(x: <TealType.uint64: 0>, n: <TealType.uint64: 0>)

exponential approximates e**x for n iterations

Parameters

  • x – The exponent to apply

  • n – The number of iterations, more is better appx but costs ops

pytealutils.math.math.factorial(x: <TealType.uint64: 0>)

factorial returns x! = x * x-1 * x-2 * …, for a 64bit integer, the max possible value is maxes out at 20

pytealutils.math.math.ln(x: <TealType.uint64: 0>)

Returns natural log of x for integer passed

pytealutils.math.math.log10(x: <TealType.uint64: 0>)

Returns log base 10 of the integer passed

uses log10(x) = log2(x)/log2(10) identity

pytealutils.math.math.log2(x: <TealType.uint64: 0>)
pytealutils.math.math.max(a: <TealType.uint64: 0>, b: <TealType.uint64: 0>) → pyteal.Expr

max returns the max of 2 integers

pytealutils.math.math.min(a: <TealType.uint64: 0>, b: <TealType.uint64: 0>) → pyteal.Expr

min returns the min of 2 integers

pytealutils.math.math.odd(x: <TealType.uint64: 0>)

odd returns 1 if x is odd

pytealutils.math.math.pow10(x: <TealType.uint64: 0>) → pyteal.Expr

Returns 10^x, useful for things like total supply of an asset

pytealutils.math.math.stack_to_wide()
pytealutils.math.math.wide_factorial(x: <TealType.bytes: 1>)

factorial returns x! = x * x-1 * x-2 * …,

pytealutils.math.math.wide_power(x: <TealType.uint64: 0>, n: <TealType.uint64: 0>)
